framework.framework_title: Writing an Abstract 1: physical and life sciences

framework_intro.para:
Here is a plan to help you write an abstract. Abstracts in the physical and life sciences usually have a combination of four moves.
There are spaces for you to add the content of your abstract.

commentary.para: The abstract occurs at the beginning of your dissertation or thesis. The main aim of the abstract is to provide the reader with a summary of your research.
The abstract is usually written at the end of the research process, and after writing the rest of the dissertation.
The model text is an abstract from the field of physical/life sciences. The article is from the journal ‘Mathematical Medicine and Biology’ and is about tear film deposition and draining.
Abstracts in most disciplines have a combination of four moves. In some disciplines, other moves are present. The most common additional move is highlighting implications of the research.
Here is the framework that was used to present this abstract.

The purpose of this move is to summarize either the aims of the text (i.e. this paper, essay, thesis or dissertation) or the research process (the aims, methods, findings). Here, the present tense is used to summarize the aims of the text.
The purpose here is to highlight the current state of knowledge in the field.
The purpose is to recount the methodological steps in the research.
The purpose is to summarize the findings/results of the study.

Use of the present tense, the present perfect tense or the past tense for presenting background information and presenting aims. Here, the present perfect tense and the present tense are used to provide background information.
Here, the present tense is used to summarize the aims of the text.
Use of the passive voice when explaining the method.
Use of the present tense or the past tense when summarizing results.

checklist.point: Decide on the key findings of your research.
Think about the number of moves you need for your discipline.
Decide on the most appropriate order of moves.
Make some notes and organize them into the plan.
Use academic language.
Avoid too many technical terms and lengthy references in the abstract.
Language Bank: highlighting implications
Grammar Focus: providing background information
Grammar Focus: presenting the aims
Grammar Focus: explaining the methods
Grammar Focus: summarizing the results
Have I presented the aims of the paper or research?
Have I provided sufficient background information?
Have I explained the methods used?
Have I summarized the results?
Have I highlighted the implications of the research, if appropriate?
Have I used only the key information from my research?
Have I avoided using too many technical terms and lengthy references?
Have I used tenses appropriately?
Have I checked vocabulary, grammar, spelling and punctuation?

paragraph.name: Writing an Abstract 1: physical and life sciences
paragraph.desc: How to write an effective summary of your research

paragraph.name: Move 1: Presenting the aims
paragraph.desc: Summarize the aims of the text (i.e. this paper, essay, thesis or dissertation) and/or the research process (the aims, methods, findings).

content.para: This paper investigatesthe deposition of the tear film on the cornea of the human eye. The tear film is laid down by the motion of the upper eyelid and then subsequently flows and thins. Of particular interest is the stability of the tear layer and the development of dry patches on the cornea.

paragraph.name: Move 2: Providing background information
paragraph.desc: Highlight the current state of knowledge in the field.

content.para: Whilethere has been significant research onthe behaviour of tear films between blinks,this paper focuses onunderstanding the mechanisms which control the shape and thickness of the deposited film and how this affects the subsequent film behaviour.

paragraph.name: Move 3: Explaining the methods
paragraph.desc: Recount the methodological steps in your research.

content.para: Numerical and analytical methods are applied toa lubrication model which includes the effects of surface tension, viscosity, gravity and evaporation.

paragraph.name: Move 4: Summarizing the results
paragraph.desc: Summarize the findings/results of the study.

content.para:
The model revealsthe importance of the eyelid velocity, motion of the surface lipid layer and the storage of tear film between blinks.
